filmography.title: Mary Poppins
filmography.role_description: A magical, firm, but kind nanny who descends from the clouds to reunite a disconnected London family.
filmography.plot: In turn of the century London, a magical nanny employs music and adventure to help two neglected children become closer to their father.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actress; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actress (Comedy/Musical)

filmography.title: The Americanization of Emily
filmography.role_description: A British war widow who falls in love with a cynical American naval officer despite her aversion to American military culture.
filmography.plot: An American naval officer talented at supplying goods to his superiors falls for a British widow during the buildup to D-Day.

filmography.title: The Sound of Music
filmography.role_description: A spirited young postulant who leaves an Austrian convent to become a governess for the seven children of a widowed naval captain.
filmography.plot: A woman leaves an Austrian convent to become a governess to the children of a Naval officer widower.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actress; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actress (Comedy/Musical)

filmography.title: Hawaii
filmography.role_description: A refined New England woman who marries a rigid missionary and struggles to adapt to life and culture in 19th-century Hawaii.
filmography.plot: An American missionary and his wife travel to the exotic island kingdom of Hawaii, intent on converting the natives.

filmography.title: Torn Curtain
filmography.role_description: A scientist's assistant and fiancée who follows him behind the Iron Curtain, discovering his defection is a ruse.
filmography.plot: An American scientist publicly defects to East Germany as part of a cloak-and-dagger mission to find the solution for a formula.

filmography.title: Thoroughly Modern Millie
filmography.role_description: An innocent small-town girl who comes to New York City in the Roaring Twenties planning to marry her boss for money.
filmography.plot: A small-town girl comes to New York City to marry a wealthy man, but finds true love instead.

filmography.title: Star!
filmography.role_description: The legendary stage actress Gertrude Lawrence, portrayed from her ambitious beginnings to her triumphs on Broadway and the West End.
filmography.plot: A musical biography of the British actress and singer Gertrude Lawrence.

filmography.title: Darling Lili
filmography.role_description: A beloved British singer during WWI who is secretly a German spy tasked with seducing an American pilot.
filmography.plot: A German spy posing as a singer is assigned to seduce an American pilot to get military secrets.

filmography.title: The Tamarind Seed
filmography.role_description: A British Home Office assistant who falls in love with a Soviet attaché during a holiday in Barbados.
filmography.plot: A British woman and a Soviet official fall in love, complicating international relations during the Cold War.

filmography.role_description: The patient girlfriend of a songwriter suffering a mid-life crisis, providing the voice of reason amidst his obsession.
filmography.plot: A Hollywood songwriter goes through a mid-life crisis and becomes infatuated with a sexy young woman.

filmography.title: Little Miss Marker
filmography.role_description: A wealthy but lonely woman who becomes involved with a bookie and a little girl left as a gambling marker.
filmography.plot: A sorrowful bookie winds up with a young girl as collateral for a bet, and she begins to reform him.

filmography.title: S.O.B.
filmography.role_description: A wholesome family-film actress who agrees to bare her breasts in a film to help her producer husband's career.
filmography.plot: A movie producer tries to salvage his latest bomb by turning it into a pornographic film.

filmography.title: Victor/Victoria
filmography.role_description: A struggling soprano in 1930s Paris who finds success by pretending to be a man who performs as a woman.
filmography.plot: A female singer finds stardom by masquerading as a male female impersonator in 1930s Paris.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actress; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actress (Comedy/Musical)

filmography.title: The Man Who Loved Women
filmography.role_description: The therapist of a compulsive womanizer who helps him understand his obsession with women.
filmography.plot: An artist, who cannot stop himself from falling in love with women, seeks psychiatric help.

filmography.title: That's Life!
filmography.role_description: A famous singer facing a health scare while trying to hold her family together during a chaotic weekend.
filmography.plot: A wealthy architect goes through a mid-life crisis while his wife deals with a potential cancer diagnosis.

filmography.title: Duet for One
filmography.role_description: A world-renowned concert violinist who is forced to re-evaluate her life when she is diagnosed with multiple sclerosis.
filmography.plot: A famous violinist is stricken with multiple sclerosis and must cope with the loss of her career and mobility.

filmography.title: Relative Values
filmography.role_description: An aristocratic matriarch who tries to maintain order when her son plans to marry a Hollywood actress.
filmography.plot: A comedy of manners set in a British country house where a Countess deals with her son's engagement to a movie star.

filmography.title: The Princess Diaries
filmography.role_description: The elegant Queen of Genovia who travels to San Francisco to groom her awkward teenage granddaughter for the throne.
filmography.plot: Mia Thermopolis has just found out that she is the heir apparent to the throne of Genovia. With her friends and family in tow, she navigates through the rest of her sixteenth year.

filmography.title: Shrek 2
filmography.role_description: The Queen of Far Far Away and mother to Fiona, who is surprised by her daughter's choice of husband.
filmography.plot: Princess Fiona's parents invite her and Shrek to dinner to celebrate her marriage, unaware that the newlyweds are both ogres.

filmography.title: The Princess Diaries 2: Royal Engagement
filmography.role_description: The Queen helps her granddaughter navigate royal protocols and suitors to secure the crown of Genovia.
filmography.plot: Now settled in Genovia, Princess Mia faces a new revelation: she is being primed for an arranged marriage to an English suitor.

filmography.title: Shrek the Third
filmography.role_description: The Queen who proves herself to be a capable fighter when the kingdom is attacked.
filmography.plot: Reluctantly designated as the heir to the land of Far, Far Away, Shrek hatches a plan to install the rebellious Artie as the new king.

filmography.title: Enchanted
filmography.role_description: The voice that opens the fairy tale story, setting the stage for the magical and modern worlds to collide.
filmography.plot: A young maiden in a land called Andalasia, who is prepared to be wed, is sent away to New York City by an evil queen.

filmography.title: Despicable Me
filmography.role_description: The hyper-critical and unimpressed mother of the supervillain Gru.
filmography.plot: When a criminal mastermind uses a trio of orphan girls as pawns for a grand scheme, he finds their love is profoundly changing him for the better.

filmography.title: Aquaman
filmography.role_description: The mythical, giant sea creature who guards the Trident of Atlan and judges Arthur Curry's worthiness.
filmography.plot: Arthur Curry, the human-born heir to the underwater kingdom of Atlantis, goes on a quest to prevent a war between the worlds of ocean and land.

filmography.title: Minions: The Rise of Gru
filmography.role_description: Reprising her role as the mother of young Gru in this prequel, showing the origins of their relationship.
filmography.plot: The untold story of one twelve-year-old's dream to become the world's greatest supervillain.
